channel.title: Take down notice from Jagex
channel.description:
I represent Jagex Limited (\"Jagex\"). Jagex has owned and operated RuneScape, the well-known online multiplayer adventure game, at the website www.runescape.com since 2001. There are currently over 10 million active registered players of the game worldwide. I hereby certify under penalty of perjury that I am authorised to act on behalf of the copyright owner. The information in this notification is accurate. I have good faith to believe that the use of the material identified below has not been authorised by the owner, its agents or the law. Under Sections 512©(3) and 512 (d)(3) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (17 U.S.C 512©(3) and 512(d)(3)), we are hereby giving you notification that; 1. Jagex Limited (UK registered company number 03982706) is the exclusive owner of the copyrights in and to the RuneScape massively multiplayer online game, the associated www.runescape.com website and the text, artwork, logos and other material appearing therein, except where otherwise stated. a) A full and representative list of the RuneScape material can be viewed at www.runescape.com . The website undertakes or facilitates information regarding the playing of an unauthorised version of our game which is a direct breach of the Terms and Conditions (\"T&C\") associated with the RuneScape massively multiplayer online game. An excerpt from the T&C is quoted below to emphasize the breach of the intellectual property rights held by Jagex: \"You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way (except to the extent allowed by applicable law). You must not use a modified/customised version of the client software or attempt to sub-license it. You must not create or provide any other means by which any Jagex Product may be played by others (including, without limitation, replacement or modified client/server software, server emulators).\" Such behaviour damages our game, and infringes our intellectual property and other legal rights. Please immediately remove or disable all access to the Infringing website of the infringing game server. Should you require any further information regarding this matter or any other evidence included in the report, please contact me at the e-mail address indicated. Yours faithfully, Bogdan Stakins Liaison, Copyright & Intellectual Property copyright@jagex.com www.jagex.com | www.runescape.com Regards, Adam D. Network Security Administrator
Yeah, I know this might be in the wrong thread but ChaosScape.net is the site that I'm assume they are talking about? Can I fight it? or shutdown? Thanks! :S

item.title: Take down notice from Jagex
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Syfal, post:22, topic:353123”]Check this out, it will help:www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff

You can fight it; like Primadude said, as long as your aren’t subject to their TOS you aren’t bound by it. And as long as you didn’t copy their code for the website you should be alright.

Edit:PM Mopar if the situation gets any worse.[/quote]the responses given there are a pile of wank

this is his response to the fact that he hosts a modified client at “http://moparisthebest.com” (previously http://moparisthebest.com/moparscape)

The internet is made of links, if it were not for links, I would have never found runescape.com to play your game, if it were not for links, you would have never found moparisthebest.com, links are not and cannot be illegal.
firstly, he [i]is[/i] hosting modified versions of copyrighted material, and secondly, even if he were only linking to an external site, it is prohibited to link to copyrighted content (at least in the us it is)

regardless, if jagex really wanted to they could take these forums down easily…just look at http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs

Read full topic

item.title: Take down notice from Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

Check this out, it will help:www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff

You can fight it; like Primadude said, as long as your aren’t subject to their TOS you aren’t bound by it. And as long as you didn’t copy their code for the website you should be alright.

Edit:PM Mopar if the situation gets any worse.

Read full topic

item.title: Take down notice from Jagex
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“someone2, post:20, topic:353123”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=449438.msg3297410#msg3297410 date=1281039899]

[quote author=someone2 link=topic=449438.msg3297393#msg3297393 date=1281039590]

I don’t pay for advertentions, don’t make videos etc. and people don’t have to pay to play, so no donator things or what. So, do you think they will take action? Or is there lesser chance if i don’t use a 24/7?
[/quote]They don’t care how long it’s on, it’s more about the numbers of players. And where you advertise. Where do you advertise?

I am going to advertise at the rune0s3rv3r forum
[/quote]‘am’? You mean you didn’t already advertise? Then how did you get 30 players.

I am thinking of around the 10-30 players, lol.[/quote]Oh, so you don’t actually have them yet. Well they shouldn’t care.

Read full topic

theres by far tomany small servers for them to take action for crap like that i don’t think they will i’ve never been in trouble and i’ve been doing this for years

unless what david said^^

item.title: Take down notice from Jagex
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

reply to them saying they broke your terms of service by entering the site

if you dont host a client or any other copyrighted material, you can ignore them; but apparently, you replicate their exact website and host their images and such.

additionally, add to your TOS that “you also agree that you do not play any jagex game, and are therefore not subject to their TOS or any other agreement with them” (from mscp/mitb’s tos), that way you can tell them that no one within your community is subject to their tos and cannot be held accountable for breaking them

Read full topic

Wouldn’t it work if you added to YOUR ToS that Jagex don’t may contact you? LMFAO.

item.description:
@EwfsPrince wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:2, topic:353123”]I don’t see how you can be infringing the terms and conditions if you don’t play RuneScape. Tell them that, and see what happens.

Some other questions:
How many players did you usually have online?
Are you 100% sure this isn’t just someone that wants to shut you down, and sent the message via php?[/quote]

thats what I suspect…
Because if they had to get my contact details they would have to go through godaddy.com and the email that they sent it to was not the email they registered with to register the domain with.

Read full topic

item.title: Take down notice from Jagex
item.dc:creator: @EwfsPrince EwfsPrince
item.description:
@EwfsPrince wrote:

I represent Jagex Limited (\"Jagex\"). Jagex has owned and operated RuneScape, the well-known online multiplayer adventure game, at the website www.runescape.com since 2001. There are currently over 10 million active registered players of the game worldwide.

I hereby certify under penalty of perjury that I am authorised to act on behalf of the copyright owner. The information in this notification is accurate. I have good faith to believe that the use of the material identified below has not been authorised by the owner, its agents or the law.

Under Sections 512©(3) and 512 (d)(3) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (17 U.S.C 512©(3) and 512(d)(3)), we are hereby giving you notification that;

  1. Jagex Limited (UK registered company number 03982706) is the exclusive owner of the copyrights in and to the RuneScape massively multiplayer online game, the associated www.runescape.com website and the text, artwork, logos and other material appearing therein, except where otherwise stated.

a) A full and representative list of the RuneScape material can be viewed at www.runescape.com .

The website undertakes or facilitates information regarding the playing of an unauthorised version of our game which is a direct breach of the Terms and Conditions (“T&C”) associated with the RuneScape massively multiplayer online game. An excerpt from the T&C is quoted below to emphasize the breach of the intellectual property rights held by Jagex:
“You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way (except to the extent allowed by applicable law). You must not use a modified/customised version of the client software or attempt to sub-license it. You must not create or provide any other means by which any Jagex Product may be played by others (including, without limitation, replacement or modified client/server software, server emulators).”
Such behaviour damages our game, and infringes our intellectual property and other legal rights.

Please immediately remove or disable all access to the Infringing website of the infringing game server.

Should you require any further information regarding this matter or any other evidence included in the report, please contact me at the e-mail address indicated.

Yours faithfully,

Bogdan Stakins
Liaison, Copyright & Intellectual Property copyright@jagex.com www.jagex.com | www.runescape.com

Regards,
Adam D.
Network Security Administrator

Yeah, I know this might be in the wrong thread but ChaosScape.net is the site that I’m assume they are talking about?
Can I fight it?
or shutdown?

Thanks! :S

Read full topic
